moves.1. d4 f5: Morphy, disliking the positional QP game, counters with a Dutch defense.
moves.2. c4 e6 3. Nc3 Nf6 4. Bg5: Harrwitz, his skills honed by thousands of games at the Cafe de la Regence, issues notice that he won't be pushed around.
moves.4... Be7 5. e3 O-O 6. Bd3 b6: Morphy wants his B on the long diagonal, anticipating that Harrwitz will castle K-side.
moves.7. Nge2 Bb7 8. O-O: You could argue a case of "castling into it", but Harrwitz wants to expand and attack on the Q-side.
moves.8... Nh5 9. Bxe7 Qxe7 10. Ng3 Nxg3: Breaking up the Pawn barricade surrounding the King.
moves.11. hxg3 d6 12. f4: To prevent a Pawn-storming attack on the weakened K-side.
moves.12... Nc6 13. g4 Nb4 14. gxf5: Ridding himself of the doubled Pawn.
moves.14... exf5 15. Qd2 Rae8 16. Rae1: Both men shift the heavy artillery to the K-side.
moves.16... Qh4: Morphy presses forward, hoping to smash Harrwitz's defenses quickly.
moves.17. Bb1 Re6 18. Qf2: Trying to break the attack by exchanging off the Queens.
moves.18... Qh5 19. d5 Rh6: Doubling on the "artificially" open KR file, with mating threats.
moves.20... Qh4 21. a3 Na6 22. b4 Nb8 23. Ne2: Trying to augment the attack by bringing the Knight into play.
moves.24. Ng3 g6 25. Kf2: Looking to escape the danger zone.
moves.25... Nf6 26. Rfh1 Ng4+ 27. Kg1 Qf6: With this retreat, the attack is broken. Morphy will have to win in the end game.
moves.28. Rxh6 Nxh6 29. Qd1: Morphy has a slight advantage with Harrwitz's KP backward and a flank majority on the K-wing.
moves.31... Re8 32. g3 Qh3 33. b5 Nf6 34. Qg2: Eliminating the Queens, and ensuring a drawn-out battle.
moves.37... Ra8: Morphy takes command of the only fully open file.
moves.38. Nd2 Ra3: Inducing Harrwitz to jettison the backward KP in hopes of counterplay.
moves.39. e4 fxe4 40. Nxe4 Nxe4 41. Bxe4 Rc3 4: Cutting off the Rook's entry squares at K7 and K8.
moves.45. Rd4 h5 46. Kf2 Kf6: Morphy is looking to utilize his wing majority on the KN and KR files.
moves.47. Rd2 Bc2 48. Ke1: Harrwitz's pieces are locked in a defensive crouch.
moves.48... Be4 49. Kf2 Kf5 50. Ra2 h4 51. gxh: Morphy charges forward, trying to constrict Harrwitz's pieces.
moves.52. Ra7: An overaggressive bid for freedom. Harrwitz's Rook was necessary for defense.
moves.52... Rh3: Threatening to create a dangerous passed Pawn with ... RxP.
moves.53. Rxc7 Rh2+ 54. Ke1 Ke3: Harrwitz resigns. If he doen't move the Bishop, he loses the piece: if he moves the B out of danger, R-R8 mates him.
